column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Customentity|identifiier|value
#Text=A REMONSTRANCE.
#Text=What bard art thou so apt to grace.
#Text=With poetrys pure breath, The icatterer of the human race !
#Text=The trafficker in death !
#Text=Are plunderd shrine, and midnight chain— A shrieking citys blaze— And beauty, in polution slain, The themes for poets praise ?
#Text=Marengos hero then recall!
#Text=Dethrone the crowned of earth !
#Text=Shake oer a weeping world deaths pallCheer Horrors brood to birth !
#Text=While startled bones of millions rise All ghastly as they stood When thunderous battle mock d the skies, And lained down human blood!
#Text=Whilst hoa y heads, all stark and gashed, Throng shore and town remote, As when the Gallic armies plashed In carnage to the throat!
#Text=His meteor-sceptre pledge once more; Napoleon to the van I Come, quaff the reeking cup of gore, And shout for slaughter !
#Text=—Man.
#Text=Another Austerlitz demand, Another Jena claim; And desolate the groaning lan 1 To write one despots fame !

#Text=Let cen the pyramids afford A verse for his renown : But speak not of brave Sidneys sword, That swept the invader down I Sing not of Moscows flaming tide— The fiery brands which hurled The chainer of the nations wide, The scourfer of the world.
#Text=With rout and havoc from their shore !
#Text=To Cossack hate consigned :— Famine and frozen wastes before, Bones and the wolf behind.
#Text=Let net Trafalgars chief, who died, A moments thought beguile; Nor laud with British heart and pride The Baltic and the Nile!
#Text=Leave Nelsons glorious flag unsung, And Wellington unwreathed; Their fame with which all Europe rung, For his— whod best neer breathed !
#Text=And gloze the tyrants guilty mood, And wail his hapless cause: That Sylla—in his thirst for blood !
#Text=That Draco—in his laws !
#Text=Mourn him who to the conscript gave HeHrt-broken France a prey; And sill could outraged nature brave With homicidal sway !
#Text=Yes, wake the throb of sympathyBid maudlin tears reveal How much men grieve for Europe freeHow miss the tyrants steel!
#Text=And make the conscious sea blush gore In shame for Nelsons land ; Make earth, revolting, lift once more Her blood-accusing hand !
#Text=CHARLES SWAIN.
